comment: I had a hard time in this course because of the way her tests were. She doesn't post her PowerPoints, so you have to go to class. Her powerpoints aren't very good so you need to pay attention to what she says in class. It is not an easy class and if you aren't good at gov i wouldn't recommend.

Take this professor! Gov has always been a hard subject for me and this professor helped me bring my D to a B. She makes time to meet individually. Pop quizzes are typically after 2 weeks of class. It's 10 question quiz so make sure you know the material pretty well. Be engaged and you'll do good in this class. She wants her students to succeed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Assignments split into pop quizzes, 3 tests, and 3 long discussions. I liked how much she encourages class discussion but as a result, we only got 4 weeks of material covered and as a result her quizzes/tests are incredibly specific so pay attention. I would have liked to learn more too, but the non mandatory textbook is there to read weekly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She is super nice and personable. You don't need to read the textbook as long as you go to class she covers most of the test material through class discussions. She does give pop quizzes and there is points for participating in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: People in the class very politely asked if she could post the slides she uses during her lecture and she got extremely offended that we asked, accusing us of just wanting to skip, and won't stop making petty comments. As punishment (for asking ig?) she said we will get heavy deductions for not coming. So ig don't ask if she could do her job lol

This professor went off topic a lot and I was left to teach myself. There is no study guides so you have no idea what is on the test. She gives pop quizzes that everyone fails because she does not teach. Going to SI is a necessity for this class if you want to learn anything. She also cancels class frequently but expects you to know everything.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Class is very easy, use the lecture guides and notes from slides and the pop quizzes to study. I just studied those 3 items the day before the test at work and made an b on every one. You dont need the book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: I made an B and this subject is by far my worst. I hate government but she has made my life so much easier! She takes the time out to actually help you if you seek it! Yes, there are pop quizzes, however, they are pretty predictable. She genuinely cares about her students and I will always respect her for that! Take her if you can! No, SERIOUSLY!
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: I had her for honors and I had a really good class! She's really nice and wants you to succeed! I only really didn't like how we only had 4 grades, but 2 of those were the midterm and final, and neither was as specific as I was expecting. Not terribly hard tests if you study. She will help you and look at your notes before presentations and stuff.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took 2 of her classes, she cares greatly for her students, and is an amazing lecturer. She encourages class discussion, although it is not mandatory. Her exams are based on quizzes, and quizzes are given randomly throughout the semester. She is very nice, and will further answer explain and answer any questions!

Go to lecture and take good notes. If she's ever late, wait until she comes or until she sends an email to cancel class (otherwise she will give out a pop quiz to spite the people who left). She's awesome
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: We had 4 exams (50 q's -- usually given a 2 point curve) and 4 quizzes (10 q's -- sometimes there was a bonus). No final. Pop quizzes were usually given out the week before the test (mostly on Tuesdays -- T/R class). Lots of discussion. Memorize only the lecture guides and attend Major Review. If you have any questions, ask. Very easy. Take her!
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Michota is pretty great. She does a good job of making her normally-would-be-boring lectures entertaining and gives easy tests. There are pop quizzes, however, but when they'll be is pretty predictable. Overall, 10/10 would take again

She's amazing, her class is very structured with 4 tests & 4 pop quizzes. The questions from quizzes will be on test, since they are pop quizzes attending class is smart. If you study & pay attention in class an A will be easy. YOU DON"T NEED THE BOOK!!! I barely cracked it open.

She is a really good lecturer. If you listen, you won't really need to touch the textbook. The test questions are closely related to discussion content, so don't skip class. Plus, she promotes class discussion and hear multiple viewpoints, which makes things interesting.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Pretty good lecturer. I never touched the book; if you pay attention in class and review your notes well you'll be good. The pop quizzes and tests ask questions that are specifically about class discussions, so make sure you show up every day. Also there are a lot of in-class debates, so if you like to argue you'll have fun.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: You need to go to class if you want to do well. I didn't touch the book all semester. 4 tests and pop quizzes are your only grades. Pay attention to what she says. I barely looked at her power points because she says what she wants you to know. Great class!

Her lectures are very informative and as interesting as possible. She encourages healthy debate during lectures which means sometimes you'll get behind on the schedule of things to cover. This isn't harmful come test time, however, because she usually doesn't put anything on the exam that wasn't covered in class. The book is mostly for vocabulary.

Being an engineering major, I had no interest going into the class. Michota understands that and makes it very interesting. Gives pop quizzes so attendance is a must. The questions on the quizzes are on the tests. She hints at what will be on tests during lecture. I really enjoyed the class and actually got something out of it, unlike many other.

LOVED HER! She has power points and her tests are moderate. She does give pop quizzes, but they come straight from the notes. She makes the large lecture hall classes seem fun and doable. I struggle a lot in large classes, but she makes the class very manageable. She is willing to help out any student and doesn't get mad if you ask questions.

She is one of the greatest teachers I have had at KSU! She is really nice and tries to engage people in the material and make things interesting. I recorded her lectures and listened to them again before the test! She says everything in class that will be on the test, no surprises.

She gives you 4 tests total, and the last one is considered the final. Nothing in her class is cumulative. She basically writes the test off of the powerpoint and she posts all the powerpoints on D2L so you don't HAVE to go to class. BUT she gives pop quizzes which has questions that are usually on the test. (and the quizzes are unannounced!)

She wants you to engage her. She wants a devil's advocate to oppose her position. She had no idea at the time how much she affected me as a freshman (so much so that I changed to a political science major). She can bring down the house for sure. I doubt you will cry during her lectures, but if you listen, you will think about her words long after.

To get an A, you HAVE to read. If you're good at the subject, the class won't be bad. If you don't know a lot about the subject beforehand, I wouldn't advise taking it unless you're ready to study hard.  She gives pop quizzes (only 4-5) and 4 tests and that's your whole grade so you have to be prepared. Be in class because you can't miss quizzes!

I am not someone who understands politics or government but she makes it super easy to understand. I still struggled in the class just due to the fact that im not good at the subject. However, she made it interesting to listen to. Her tests are based off her powerpoints. The pop quiz questions are on the test so study those! shes amazing!

Such a great professor. She was always willing to help you one one on one and would sometimes have to run to her next class because she was answering as many questions as she could after class ended. She does not post powerpoints so you habe to take notes if your not a verbal learner, but I didn't take any notes and still got an A.
As long as you keep up with the schedule and participate in class you shouldn't have any problems.

Four tests, quizzes every now and then (not announced) but attendance is not mandatory. Lecture is clear and exactly what is on the test. All power points are online but still go to class because she mentions stuff thats not in the power points.

Great teacher. Knows her stuff. Take her she is probably the best gov teacher here. You must come to class however, you will miss stuff. 4 exams and 3 to 6 pop quizzes. She drops the lowest quiz grade.

4 non-cumulative tests and 1 pop quiz per test.  Every quiz question/answer shows up on the 50 question tests.  Study chapter vocab, her PowerPoints, quiz, and write down what she says in class, and you can make an 'A'.  Great teacher.  Explains things really well.  Take her.

You HAVE to read in order to get a good grade in her class. I would read almost every chapter and still get B's on the test and the test get harder. But they are not that difficult. She also gives 3-6 Pop quizzes and drops the lowest quiz grade so you basically have to come to class.

She is a great teacher who really knows her stuff! She does give pop quizzes throughout the semester, but they arent hard. The test material comes from her ppts and the book, so there is not a question that isnt covered somewhere. She also loves debates (to a point) and hearing students opinions on the matters that are being talked about.

She is awesome! Encourages class debates and discussions. Syllabus says attendance is mandatory, but I don't think it counted against me in the end. Very clear and gives you all the info you'll need for the test. Some questions straight from powerpoints and "pop" quizzes (she hints to them the class before). She eally loves what she does.
